On 05/01/2008, newtwist2000 <rkdelisle@...> wrote:
>
>  A bit of an aside, the ability to establish modularity may be a
>  significant next step.  Most EC applications are limited in this
>  capacity.  I'm not sure if NEAT is fully compatible with modularity or
>  not - thoughts?

Just on this point - I would say that the ability of CPPN's to
generate repeated structures and elaboratations on those repeated
structures means that modularity (re-use) is inherently part of the
CPPN model.  I know this is a central part of why CPPNs were devised
but I'm not sure that the word modularity has come up before when
discussing CPPNs.

Anyway it's another nice characteristic of CPPNs because it means we
no longer have to explicitly write code to allow modularity.

Colin.
